title: When The Military Fights A Pandemic At Home
description: Last Tuesday, the military helped evacuate dozens of critically ill COVID-19 patients from overwhelmed hospitals in Queens. NPR's Rebecca Hersher says what happened that night shows how training for war does — and does not — prepare members of the armed services for a pandemic at home.

itunes:title: When The Military Fights A Pandemic At Home
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: On a recent night in New York, some critically ill COVID-19 patients had to be evacuated from overwhelmed hospitals in Queens. It took 3 branches of the military to get it done.
itunes:subtitle: On a recent night in New York, some critically ill COVID-19 patients had to be evacuated from overwhelmed hospitals in Queens. It took 3 branches of the military to get it done.
content:encoded: Last Tuesday, the military helped evacuate dozens of critically ill COVID-19 patients from overwhelmed hospitals in Queens. NPR's Rebecca Hersher says what happened that night shows how training for war does — and does not — prepare members of the armed services for a pandemic at home.
